BTW, I do have Firefox installed on the computer, as well as Chrome. xxxxxx Followup; I've apparently gotten stuff working. I stumbled upon this thread about hyperlinks not working https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/hyperlinks-in-messages-not-working So I looked at 'default programs' in Win7 control panel. Thanks for the help!

content:
kernel32.dll is one of three core components of the entire windows architecture. shell32.dll and system32.dll being the other two. These are really "windows" and everything else builds on top of it. If you are having issues with that DLL, it is not something that a reinstall of any software but windows will fix.

However thanks to google, the answer is your version of chrome is not compatible with windows 7. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/answers/questions/1181142/google-chrome-windows-7-desktop-app-will-not-open

So I suggest you move to Firefox for a while. They will continue to support Windows 7 for a short time, although they to have announced a withdrawal of support. I "think" V115 will be the last major version of Thunderbird to support windows 7 as well, following from the change to Firefox (they are both based on the Mozilla platform.)

content:
There is no backward compatibility of profiles, regardless of how they go backwards. You certainly can not "move" them using backup and restore. Not successfully in my experience.

Export does not mess with IMAP emails as they will be downloaded when Thunderbird starts. I don't like it, but that is how it has always worked. Import does not import passwords. Again a failure that has not yet been addressed after more than a year.

There is a feedback forum linked to from the Thunderbird help menu. Perhaps you have feedback to offer the developers.

content:
For us to better investigate this issue, we will need some more information.

Could you please do the following?

  1. Open the menu > Help > Troubleshooting Information, then click Copy text to Clipboard.
  2. Go to https://pastebin.mozilla.org/, paste the clipboard by right clicking in the large text area, select paste from the menu, change the retention period to expire in 28 days, use the Paste Snippet button to create a page containing your info, then copy the resulting URL (address) of the page created.

  4. Please also provide results for the following test on your system
    • Does Thunderbird work as expected in Thunderbird troubleshooting mode?

content:
In the attached pictures, I have set the background of a selected message to navy, both for Table View and Cards View. Cards View has a thicker row. This can be done with a userChrome.css file: 

/* background colour for selected messages in threads pane */  tr[is="thread-row"].selected {   color: white !important;   background-color: navy !important; }  tr[is="thread-card"].selected {   color: white !important;   background-color: navy !important; }


Help/Troubleshooting Info (TB 115), Profile Folder, Open Folder, close TB, create a new folder named chrome, create a new document in chrome with a text editor, name it userChrome.css, Save as type: All files *.*, copy in the above code, change the colours as desired. Double-click toolkit.legacyUserProfileCustomizations.stylesheets to true in Settings/General/Config. editor, restart TB.

Online css generator

content:
If you're on Linux and apparmor is running AND you, like me, want to also be running the latest version of Firefox, then the trouble is that the Thunderbird apparmor profile is mis-configured for this setup.

To fix this:

1) Add this line to /etc/apparmor.d/usr.bin.thunderbird: 

 /opt/firefox/firefox-bin Pux,    # <-- note:                     # adjust the path and name to your firefox


2) Important: Now restart apparmor to re-load this profile using: $ sudo /etc/init.d/apparmor restart

Note: this means you trust your version of Firefox, as it bypasses the default security handshake between Thunderbird and the older version of Firefox it wants to call. But given that I keep the latest version of Firefox installed it's most likely that it has more security holes patched then the previous version of Firefox which doesn't have those holes patched. It's a judgement call here, and there IMHO is no really right security answer.

And YES this DID solve the problem, at least for me.

But NO, I won't be clicking the "Did this reply solve your problem? [Solved the Problem]" button here, which locks this thread to others who might have other solutions to later add.

There are two parts to this. 1. Thunderbird's junk and spam settings. discussed here https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/thunderbird-and-junk-spam-messages


2. If your account is IMAP Your mail providers setting for junk/SPAM.

Finally many internet security suite/ Antivirus products come with junk / Spam tools that also interact with the results you see. Does your anti virus have a spam tool like kaspersky does?

content: Proton uses a locally installed IMAP server. They call it the bridge. IMAP folders tend to loose their content when Thunderbird can not synchronize properly with the server. In this case the bridge. My guess is something is wrong there. Quite possible something to to with a firewall or antivirus as a new version of Thunderbird is involved. They can be quite finicky about version numbers of software especially in their software firewalls. But you might want to check the bridge is unaffected.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
It is probably very simple. Generally these issues on a new update are directly caused by the antivirus program (firewall component usually) refusing to allow Thunderbird access to the internet (it does not recognize the version number)

The simple solution is to ensure Thunderbird version 115 is allowed in the software firewall and any email scanning is disabled.

content:
To diagnose problems with Thunderbird, try one of the following:

  • Restart Thunderbird with add-ons disabled (Thunderbird Safe Mode). On the Help menu, click on "Restart with Add-ons Disabled". If Thunderbird works like normal, there is an Add-on or Theme interfering with normal operations. You will need to re-enable add-ons one at a time until you locate the offender.
  • Restart the operating system in safe mode with Networking. This loads only the very basics needed to start your computer while enabling an Internet connection. Click on your operating system for instructions on how to start in safe mode: Windows 10, Windows 8, Windows 7, Windows Vista, Windows XP, OSX
If safe mode for the operating system fixes the issue, there's other software in your computer that's causing problems. Possibilities include but not limited to: AV scanning, virus/malware, background downloads such as program updates.

content:
The answer is obvious as it is in the posted information. invalid credentials.

So I suggest you check your gmail account settings in account settings and ensure they are correct. Things like your user name being set to your gmail email address, your authorization method being set to oauth2.0 because clearly your currents credentials and no longer valid according to Google.

Perhaps try logging into your google mail using your browser and see if there is anything of note from google about your access.

I see you posted another topic. Forget it. Google are complaining about your credentials. I doubt the version of Thunderbird has anything to do with it at all.
